page.title: 16MY HOBBY AT PORTESSIE BEACH
page.content: MY DAD HAS A BOAT CALLED THE OSPREY. IT IS ABOUT FIVE YEARS OLD. MY DAD CATCHES LOBSTERS, PARTINS AND EELS IN THE CREELS THAT HE HAS PUT IN THE WATER. I USUALLY HELP DAD IN THE BOAT. IT IS GREAT FUN. TO CATCH PARTINS AND LOBSTERS, WE USE DIFFERENT KINDS OF BAIT MOSTLY SALT HERRING, SMOKED HERRING OR PLAICE. THE MOST COMMON PLACES TO CATCH THEM ARE THE BEACON, MUCKS AND THE CROWN. WE SELL THEM TO SOMEONE IN CULLEN WHO COOKS THEM FOR A RESTAURANT. IF THEY ARE 2 POUND LOBSTERS, YOU WOULD GET Â£10.50 FOR FIVE OF THEM. WHEN I AM NOT WITH DAD, I CATCH FISH IN THE ROCK POOLS. I USE A CLEEK -THAT IS A BIT OF STICK WITH A HOOKED BIT OF METAL AT THE END OF THE STICK. IF I AM AT THE ROCKS FOR 2 HOURS, I WOULD CATCH ABOUT 3 GRINDIES.
